utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, what are you working on these days?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m studying one-celled organisms to try and find the neurochemicals that lead to the feeling of shame.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What would a one-celled organism have to be embarrassed about?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Same as all of us, getting out of a car without underwear.

utterance.speaker: Bermadette
utterance.content: Speaking of underwear, I have some interesting news.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, if it’s sometimes Howie wears yours, Leonard already told us.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He was being funny. I’m pretty sure. Anyway, I was asked to be a part of a magazine article about the 50 sexiest female scientists in California. Isn’t that cool?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think it’s awful.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Bernadette is a successful microbiologist. She should be celebrated for her achievements, not her looks. I mean, what kind of message does that send?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I think the message is check out the rack on that scientist.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why can’t someone be thought of as both smart and pretty?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I just don’t think a professional woman should have to flaunt her sexuality in order to get ahead.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, what’s the big deal? Look, if it helps me make a sale with a physician, I don’t think it hurts to flirt a little. I mean, laugh at their joke, touch their arm, maybe crank up the AC in the car beforehand, you know, to wake up the girls.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Maybe it’s different in the world of sales, but it’s already hard enough for women to be taken seriously in science.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I was kind of excited about the article, but now you’re making me feel bad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I think you should do whatever you want. You know, maybe if fashion magazines had female scientists in them, I would’ve become a theoretical physicist. Stop smirking at each other.

utterance.speaker: Man with Flowers
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, thank you. Delivery men are the unsung foot soldiers of our nation’s commerce. It’s because of people like you, people like me can limit our human contact. I’d shake your hand, but, well, you know.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: I’m not a delivery man, I’m a doctor. Although I do often deliver alarming biopsy results to my patients.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s humorous.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I bet you leave your patients in stitches. That was also humorous.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you bringing flowers to a patient to cushion the blow of a terminal diagnosis? That wasn’t a joke.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: All right. These are actually for a nice woman who makes sales calls to my office.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. You know, they have delivery people that will do that for you.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: I was hoping to impress her by tracking her down on the Internet and then showing up unannounced at her door.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Making the extra effort. Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great timing, food just got here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ooh, Siam Palace?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, mee krob and chicken satay?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, extra peanut sauce?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, but you can have mine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Eh, well, very well. Oh, and on the topic of sharing things that are yours, there is a gentleman caller bringing flowers to your fiancée as we speak.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? Why didn’t you say that first?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why didn’t you get extra peanut sauce? We can both play this game.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, hi. Uh, does Penny live here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: May I ask why?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Well, uh, I met her at my office, she winked at me. And, uh, I came hoping to initiate a romantic relationship.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, um, look, I’m pretty sure she didn’t wink at you.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, she did. Seductively, like this. And then she touched my arm for two Mississippis. Like, you know, one Mississippi, two…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I got it, I got it. Listen, um, I think there’s been a misunderstanding. See, Penny is my fiancée.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Really? I’ve never seen her wear an engagement ring.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: So, am I to presume that her flirtation was just a sales technique?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: When will I learn? It’s just like the cute girl at the pet store all over again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, uh, she touched my arm for five Mississippis, and I bought a two thousand dollar iguana habitat. Which she was always too busy to come over and see. You give these to Penny. You’re a, you’re a lucky man.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, uh, you probably don’t want her to see this. It’s unnecessarily graphic.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hold on, Doctor. Leonard, where are your social skills? This man is clearly upset. We should invite him in for a hot beverage.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He tried to score with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So have these two, and they’re having dinner with us.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, how was work today?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It was fine, but you’ll be happy to know they pulled the sexy scientists article.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know. They just canceled the photo shoot and said they’re rethinking it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I’m really sorry, but I think it’s for the best. You want people focusing on your achievements, not staring at your breasts in some magazine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I guess. It’s really not that important. Hey, up here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sorry, it’s just we’re, we were talking about them. So, look, I, I wasn’t going to say anything, but since you seem to be okay with the article being canceled, I have a little confession. I’m the reason it was pulled.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What? How?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I sent the editors of the magazine a pretty scathing e-mail.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Amy, what did you say?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I simply pointed out that they would never consider doing an article ranking male scientists on their sexuality, let alone showing them in various stages of undress.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Because no one wants to see Neil deGrasse Tyson in a wet T-shirt, bent over the hood of a Porsche.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, it doesn’t make a difference, because they agreed it was in bad taste, and now you agree, so Amy saves the day.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, what happened was you got jealous, so you took away a chance for me to get some publicity.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But it was bad publicity.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s for me to decide, not you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I disagree. As a female scientist, I think what you do affects all of us.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And I think you don’t like people expressing their sexuality because no one wants you to express yours. Oh, Amy, I’m so sorry. That was over the line.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You have a nice night.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Please don’t go. Up until my vicious attack, you were the one in the wrong.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here you go, Doctor. Red Zinger with one teaspoon of honey.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Thank you. Neat Star Trek mug. I actually have one of the phasers from the original TV show.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, cool.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How’d you get that?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, easy, Gene Roddenberry needed a vasectomy.

utterance.speaker: Sehldon
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You’ve snipped Gene Roddenberry’s vas deferens?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, he really went where no man has gone before.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: I don’t like to brag,but, uh, you see, I’m kind of the doctor to the stars’ urinary tracts.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Uh, you, you want to see James Cameron’s kidney stone?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: He was so happy after he passed it, he gave me a Terminator.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That is amazing. How long have you been collecting?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Ever since I was a kid, but, uh, I didn’t really get serious until William Shatner’s bladder infection.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’d you get? What’d you get?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Well, he said it was a tribble. It could be a toupee, but either way, it’s pretty cool.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I would love to see your collection.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Anytime. Uh, I’ve got some cool stuff. When I first started, I thought it would be a good way to meet women, but, well, you know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We know.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Preach.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Can I ask you a personal question?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Um, I mean, you’re a guy like me, so how’d you get a girl like Penny?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Well, you know, just being myself, really.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, please, you know, I’ll tell you how he did it. Implacable, relentless badgering. In urology terms, he was a drug-resistant staph infection. And she was a urethra that could not shake him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know that I’d call myself an infection.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A gallant man would defend his fiancée for being called a urethra.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can we please change the subject?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, that didn’t go your way.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Dr. Lorvis, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Uh, well, actually I came to see you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah, that’s a good question. Apparently someone was being awfully flirty while not wearing their engagement ring, causing another someone to show up here thinking the first someone might be available.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, God. Don’t make it so hard on her. Look, the first someone is the deceitful you. The second someone is the delightful Dr. Lorvis.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, this is very embarrassing. Dr. Lorvis, I am so sorry. I did not mean to lead you on.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: You touched my arm for two Mississippis.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. That’s why you were mumbling Mississippi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can we talk in private?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Please, yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So what other celebrity genitalia have you handled?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, uh, what’s the deal? You take off your ring when you go to work?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? No, no, I just put it on the other hand and turn it around. Keep that hand in my pocket.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what do you mean why? Look, I make more sales if these doctors think I’m single. I did the same kind of thing as a waitress. The real question is, what is he doing in your apartment?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, he was upset. So Sheldon invited him in for a hot beverage.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You were okay with that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. I got upset. And Sheldon made me a beverage, too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, he just showed up at my door. Don’t you think that’s a little weird?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A little, but he’s basically harmless. He’s actually kind of a nice guy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Whatever, look, my company does not allow me to socialize with doctors outside of work. You got to get rid of him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why am I the one that has to get rid of him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t do it, he’s my best client.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, I’ll get rid of him. But you owe me one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, we’re going to Oliver’s house to see his collection. You want to go with us?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. You owe me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I was wrong. Heaven does exist. And it’s in the basement of a urologist’s house in Sherman Oaks.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Welcome to my Fortress of Solitude. This is where I go to get away from all my other solitude.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on. It’s a replica.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Original.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I think I just cheated on my wife.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The gun from Hellboy?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Yup.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How did you get it?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Bought it at auction.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I was hoping for a juicy tidbit about Ron Perlman’s testicles.

utterance.speaker: Woman’s voice (off)
utterance.content: Oliver, I’m going to play bingo.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Okay, Mother. Have fun.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Still lives with his ma. Yikes, right?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m not quite sure how to respond.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow, Donkey Kong. This, this was my game when I was a kid.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because it’s a story of a pretty blonde girl tirelessly pursued by a small, oddly-shaped man?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, because I liked it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, now, don’t get defensive. You’re oddly-shaped, but you got the girl.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: So, I’ve noticed Leonard gets teased a lot 0about his relationship with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. If you’d like to join in, the premise is their love seems unlikely and doomed to failure.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: So, you think she’ll be single soon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, if you want to get in on the pool, you’re too late. All the squares have been purchased.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Interesting. Excuse me, I have to take care of something.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, as your friend I feel I should tell you something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m still upset about that peanut sauce.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Oh, could you hold the door?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Nice flowers.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Thank you. They’re for a girl. Uh, I’m being implacable and relentless.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Isn’t she lucky?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: She keeps sending me mixed signals. But I think we both want the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Unconditional love.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess that’s all anybody wants.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: I guess so.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I hope you get it.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: One Mississippi, two Mississippi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Next game, let’s switch helmets.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I’d look silly in that helmet.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I can’t take these.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Why not? I mean, you want what I want. And we had two wonderful Mississippis.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But what about the other girl?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Oh, right. I’ll tell her we should just be friends.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Dr. Lorvis?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Penny, we should just be friends. Happy?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You think he bites?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stick your head in there and find out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You fooled me with that goat at the petting zoo. You will not fool me again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wonder where Dr. Lorvis is. He’s been gone a while.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe he’s playing bingo with his mommy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s sad how some guys can’t cut the apron strings.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, now you’re messing with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, guys, we’re locked in here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, this day just keeps getting better.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, you just left them alone playing games in your house?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Well, they seemed happy and I thought that would give me time for you and I to get to know each other better. That was before we met.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We all have a past.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Doc, you’ve got to see what you’re doing is, is a little creepy.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: You sound just like Sigourney Weaver when I followed her into a restroom.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you can’t just go chasing after every girl who’s nice to you.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Well, that’s not what Sheldon says. And he seems to know his way around the ladies.

utterance.speaker: Penny (on phone)
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard. Guess who’s back. Dr. Lorvis. Yeah. You care to join us? What? You locked them in your basement?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Well, they’re, they’re not locked in. The door just sticks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, so how do they unstick it?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: They’d need the key.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Nope. That’s it. We are gonna go over there right now, and you are going to let them out.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Three Mississippi, four Mississippi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Move it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, good, you’re here. Amy, I am so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That has to wait. This weirdo locked the guys up in his basement.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: She seems nice. Who’s she?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just walk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can do this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: One ladder left.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh-hom yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Next level.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Better than okay. I am having the game of my life.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Dr. Lorvis, isn’t there something you want to say?

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Yes. I’m very sorry for locking you in my home.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, that was very uncool. Get the hammer. Get the hammer.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, Leonard, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just hang on.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Well, while we wait, would you like to see Tobey Maguire’s prostate sonogram?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Dr Lorvis
utterance.content: Oh, spoiler alert. He was worried about nothing.
